data.text: Dahlin hit the post, but other than that, good kill by DeSmith and the Penguins.
Guentzel is called for interference with 7:34 remaining in the first.

The Penguins have an 8-1 edge in shots with eight minutes left in the period. They've completely flipped the script from last night, where the Sabres completely tilted the ice in their favor in the opening frame.

GOAL! SIDNEY CROSBY!

The Penguins take a 2-0 lead with 13:09 remaining in the opening frame!

The Penguins have now scored a power-play goal in five straight games, going 7-for-20 over that span.

Mike Sullivan: "They're just feeling it, you know?"

GOAL! RICKARD RAKELL!

The Penguins take a 1-0 lead with 59 seconds left on the power play!
The Penguins are heading right back to the man-advantage after Poehling draws a two-minute minor for high-sticking.
They don't score but the first unit got a couple of good looks. Letang went out with the second unit.
The Penguins are getting a power play just 1:01 into the period. Doesn't look like Letang is rejoining the top unit just yet (he did just finish a shift, though).
Puck drops to start the second game of this home-and-home back-to-back with Buffalo here at PPG Paints Arena. Game on!
The fans here give Kris Letang an amazing ovation when he's announced as part of the starting lineup 🥰

The Penguins franchise defenseman returns to the lineup less than two weeks after suffering a stroke. 

Cannot put into words what a warrior he is. https://t.co/Ts0nUyHoVS
RT @JG_PxP: Kris Letang is on the ice for warmup. Unbelievable. What a friggin warrior. Let's go! #Pens

Jeff Carter on the Sabres: "You look at them play this year, they’re a highly skilled team and they transition really well. If you give them opportunities to do that, they’re going to make you pay."

Here are your @Honda Keys to Victory for the rematch with Buffalo. https://t.co/4hr8aW4puX
Mike Sullivan said Kris Letang skated this morning, and is available to play tonight. He’ll be a game-time decision.
@TheRick2458 Yes they are!
RT @NHLPlayerSafety: Buffalo’s Jeff Skinner has been suspended for three games for Cross-checking Pittsburgh’s Jake Guentzel. https://t.co/…

Jeff Carter on his netminder: "They had a lot of real good looks. Jars has been really solid for us here the last little while. He's seeing pucks and making the saves when we're under siege a little bit, and that was a big boost for us tonight." https://t.co/GqBGNeZFQH

Mike Sullivan: "I think it's a sign of a good team when you can bend but don't break, so to speak. I didn't think we had a great start, obviously. Tristan made some key saves for us. As the game went on, we got better. I thought from the third period on, we were the better team."

Sidney Crosby, on his play to set up Rickard Rakell's goal: "I was just trying to keep it in. Trying to find some way. Sometimes it's not pretty, but you got to find a way to keep it in. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Glad it ended up in a goal."
Jeff Carter: "To be honest with you, I didn't see it come through the D's legs there. It just hit my skate and kind of sat nicely for me, so it was a real nice play by Ricky." https://t.co/AsR5XNkA7N
GOAL!!! BIG JEFF CARTER WINS IT IN OVERTIME FOR THE PENGUINS!!!
Puck drops to start overtime. Crosby, Malkin, Rakell and Petry are out to start the 4-on-3 power play for Pittsburgh.
Guentzel has returned to the ice and went straight to the box to serve his penalty.
We are heading to overtime in Buffalo.

Jake Guentzel gave Jeff Skinner a little whack, and he retaliated in a big way, cross-checking him repeatedly and catching him up high. Guentzel was bleeding and headed to the room.

They each got two minutes for slashing, with Skinner also getting a five-minute major.
That was actually a 6-on-4 goal for Buffalo, with Kyle Okposo scoring from the slot with 90 seconds left in regulation.
The Sabres tie it with a power-play goal.
The Sabres are using their timeout before heading to the man-advantage.
Malkin heads to the box with 3:02 remaining. Gut check time for the Penguins PK.

GOAL! BROCK MCGINN!

The Penguins take a 3-2 lead with 3:30 left to play!
There is 4:34 remaining in regulation coming out of this last TV timeout.
They take care of business AGAIN! Fantastic work by the PKers and Jarry.
Now Crosby is called for tripping. The Penguins PK goes back to work with 10:09 left in regulation and the score tied 2-2.
They take care of business! Back to full strength.
P.O Joseph is called for tripping. The Penguins PK goes to work.
That goal came as the result of a phenomenal effort by Sidney Crosby to keep the play alive. He literally played goalie at the blue line.

GOAL! RICKARD RAKELL!

The Penguins tie it 2-2 just under three minutes into the final frame!
The Penguins are getting their fourth power play of the evening just 12 seconds in. They are 1-for-3 so far tonight.
Puck drops to start the third period between the Penguins and the Sabres. Time for a comeback! Game on!
Horn sounds to end the 2nd. Tough finish there for the Penguins. After Pittsburgh opened the scoring with a goal from Guentzel, Buffalo took the lead with tallies 1:07 apart.

We hate to see the Sabres score... but their individual goal songs are fire. Olofsson's is Abba's Gimme! Gimme! Gimme! (A Man After Midnight), and Skinner's is Mariah Carey's All I Want for Christmas Is You.

annotations.normalized_text: All I Want for Christmas Is You

data.text: The Sabres take a 2-1 lead with a pair of quick goals from Victor Olofsson and Jeff Skinner.
Pittsburgh's power play has been buzzing. On that particular opportunity, they were calm and methodical. Guentzel then had time to line up his shot, with Rakell at the net front acting as the screen.

GOAL! JAKE GUENTZEL!

The Penguins take a 1-0 lead with a power-play goal!
Mittelstadt takes an interference penalty on Rakell, sending Pittsburgh to their third power play of the night with 5:40 remaining in the 2nd.
Shortly after the Penguins go back to full strength, Guentzel gets a step on the D and creates a scoring chance for himself.
Now the Penguins will be shorthanded after Jason Zucker is called for hooking.
Brock McGinn draws a hooking penalty and the Penguins head to their second power play of the night with 12:57 left in the 2nd.

GUYS! IT'S TIME FOR THE BIG MAC ATTACK!

We've hit it two games in a row, can we make it three?!

If the Penguins score in the next three minutes, download the @McDonalds app and get a free Big Mac with purchase starting tomorrow, valid for three days.
Horn sounds to end a scoreless 1st. Buffalo was the better team for most of it, but the Penguins did have a good surge at the end. Shots are 13-5 Sabres.

The first unit had the zone for the first 90 seconds. They were moving it well and ripping the puck when they had the chance. Then the second unit nearly converted a great opportunity. Definitely something to build on.

Brock McGinn made a great diving play in the slot to allow Jeff Carter to take possession of the puck. He deked and got a backhand shot... and on the next shift, the Penguins earned a power play. Little bit of life for the boys in black and gold.
Buffalo now has a 12-2 edge in shots with just under six minutes left in the opening frame. 😬
Tristan Jarry has already had to come up with two Grade-A stops (and got some help from the crossbar on another). He's keeping his team in this right now.
The Sabres are off to a strong start, outshooting the Penguins 6-1 in the opening six minutes.
Puck drops to start the first game of this home-and-home back-to-back in Buffalo! Game on!

If you are looking for a good gift idea, look no further! You can never have enough candles, in my opinion, and the proceeds from these ones selected by the Lady Pens will support their Angel Fund that benefits non-profits in the community. 💛 https://t.co/sOYr7N9hTH
Tristan Jarry gets the start tonight in Buffalo for the first set of this home-and-home back-to-back.
When asked if Kris Letang is available to play tonight, Mike Sullivan said no, he will not play tonight.
Kris Letang is on the ice for the Penguins optional morning skate in Buffalo. https://t.co/hkBYNARHMv
RT @penguins: Letang on returning to practice: "The team brought me in and treated me like they usually do. So that made me feel at home an…
Kris Letang, on what his symptoms were like with this second stroke and how things proceeded from there ⬇️ https://t.co/4Aajf0LdE5
Dr. Vyas came into the media room and took questions, then Letang spoke, and then Sullivan. Full story to come.

Kris Letang: "People know me well by now, and know that hockey is a passion for me. It’s going to take a lot to drag me out of it. But at the same time, I know the danger. I know all the risks I’m taking, and if there’s none, I’ll resume playing. That’s the case right now."

Kris Letang: "Stroke is a scary word, and I’m lucky I have the staff that we have. I know I’m in good hands." He stopped to knock on wood before saying, "I’ve been lucky these things have resolved on their own and I can go back to a normal life."

Letang mentioned a couple of times that he and Dr. Vyas have a great relationship dating back 10-plus years. "Me and Dharmesh have a clear understanding that we're going to take all the time we need, and do all the research possible to make sure it's safe for me to play."

Kris Letang, on what this has been like for his family: "Scary, to be honest. My kids, they don't care if I'm a hockey player or not,. They care about having a dad. Same with my wife. She knows there's so much more than hockey. It was hard, but we've been through this."
Kris Letang: "(Physically), obviously when you don't skate with the team or for an hour at high intensity, you lose a little conditioning. Gotta build it back up."

Kris Letang: "Mentally, I feel good to be back, to be honest. It's always hard to be on the sidelines. I know health comes first, and I'm really lucky to have the (medical) staff we have... We're taking all the time we need to figure this thing out."

Head team physician Dr. Dharmesh Vyas on Kris Letang, who is now listed as day to day: "He always surprises us with how well he heals. We don't think this is accelerated in any way." Said they're taking all precautions to ensure he is safe and ready to play when the time comes.
Hey Tanger 🥹 https://t.co/ASs3rUc0q3
Kris Letang is on the ice for Penguins practice in a regular yellow jersey. 🤩

RT @JG_PxP: All-new @Highmark Coach's Show returns TONIGHT from 6-6:30P on @1059thex!

➡️ Looking back on a 3-1-1 homestand
➡️ The collecti…

Today the Penguins are doing an off-ice workout instead of an on-ice practice. They’ll skate in Cranberry tomorrow at 11 AM before flying to Buffalo for the first game of their back-to-back home-and-home with the Sabres.

Blueger on getting his first: "It felt great. As much as you try not to think about, it is in the back of your mind a little bit. It's frustrating I had that chance on the penalty shot and kind of wasted it. Yeah, I think I'll sleep better tonight after getting that last one."

Teddy Blueger, on what changed after the first: “We came out a little bit flat, and they came out with a lot of energy. We know we're a way better team than that. So we just kind of had to respond, and just kind of upped the ante a little bit.”
Teddy tried telling me that Sid got the helmet when we walked into the room 😐😂 https://t.co/npP72hY71J

Bryan Rust, on what's working for him right now - with goals in two straight after one in 14: "Playing on my toes. The line’s playing well. I'm seeing the ice a little bit better. Obviously, a little bit of confidence helps." He also stole a Sully word - stick-to-it-ive-ness.
Bryan Rust said he didn't feel too good after blocking a shot, which is why he briefly left. "I was definitely a bit concerned, but obviously, happy I was able to come back."

Mike Sullivan on Sidney Crosby: "He's just a wiser version of himself, if that's possible. He's such a student of the game. Not just his own game, but the game in general. ... Sometimes, we just shake our head with his creativity and how he thinks the game."

THAT'LL DO IT!

The Penguins earn a 4-1 victory over Columbus and have now picked up points in 12 of 14 to go 10-2-2 over that span!

After Merzlikins makes an incredible diving play to save an empty netter -

GOAL! BLUEGER!

The Penguins take a 4-1 lead with 3:27 left!
We'll be 4-on-4 for 25 seconds after Petry is called for tripping, then Pittsburgh will be shorthanded. There is 3:40 left to play.
And just like that, Guentzel is back out!

Jake Guentzel heads to the locker room with 6:29 left to play after clipping skates with Erik Gudranson and going into the boards. He is slow to get up, and head athletic trainer Chris Stewart comes out, but Guentzel skates off on his own.
The Blue Jackets have been surging a bit around this midway point of the period. Jarry's been really good.
Josh Archibald is called for hooking, giving CBJ their fourth power play of the game.

"I think that they've gained some traction - both units, as of late - and we're hopeful we can continue to build on that."
- Mike Sullivan on the PP this morning. He was right.
The Crosby line draws a penalty on the first shift after creating some scoring chances.
Puck drops to start the final frame. Game on!

After combining for 10 points in Saturday's win over St. Louis, the Malkin line looked fantastic in that second period. The puck feels like it's been glued to Geno's stick, and he's making some great plays.
Horn sounds to end a second period that was night and day compared to the first period. The Penguins turned a 1-0 deficit into a 3-1 lead with goals from Crosby (2) and Rust.
Blueger tries snapping a shot five-hole, but Merzlikins makes the stop.
TEDDY BLUEGER IS GETTING A PENALTY SHOT
The Penguins didn't score, but they looked great. Their recent PP struggles feel pretty far away right now.
The Penguins are back on the power play, as the failed coach's challenge means Columbus gets a delay of game penalty.
It is deemed there is no goalie interference! The tally stands! https://t.co/IBki1CsPrq
Hold on. The Blue Jackets are challenging for goalie interference.

GOAL! SIDNEY CROSBY AGAIN!

The Penguins take a 3-1 lead with 1:15 left on the power play!

Tristan Jarry extended his career-long point streak to 10 games with tonight's overtime win (8-0-2). 

Jarry's point streak is the longest by a @penguins goaltender since Matt Murray's 10-game streak in 2017-18 (9-0-1). https://t.co/UsnMSWKXNn

GOAL! JAKE GUENTZEL!

The Penguins take a 1-0 lead with a power-play goal!
Brock McGinn draws a hooking penalty and the Penguins head to their second power play of the night with 12:57 left in the 2nd.

Letang on returning to practice: "The team brought me in and treated me like they usually do. So that made me feel at home and felt comfortable. To be around them, watch the games, be able to practice today - it's great for the mind."

urls.title: Letang Cleared to Practice with Penguins, 10 Days After Suffering Stroke
urls.description: "He's always surprised us with how well he heals. We don't think that this (return) is accelerated in any way," said head team physician Dr. Dharmesh Vyas. "We're taking all the right precautions to make sure that he's safe to go out and play."

tweets.text: Kris Letang: "Stroke is a scary word, and I’m lucky I have the staff that we have. I know I’m in good hands." He stopped to knock on wood before saying, "I’ve been lucky these things have resolved on their own and I can go back to a normal life."

Kris Letang, on what this has been like for his family: "Scary, to be honest. My kids, they don't care if I'm a hockey player or not,. They care about having a dad. Same with my wife. She knows there's so much more than hockey. It was hard, but we've been through this."

Kris Letang: "Mentally, I feel good to be back, to be honest. It's always hard to be on the sidelines. I know health comes first, and I'm really lucky to have the (medical) staff we have... We're taking all the time we need to figure this thing out."
